other_tests.findings: Marked attenuation of sensory responses with motor function spared. Sensory amplitudes of the upper extremities (median, ulnar, radial nerves) were diminished as or more so than those of the lower extremities (sural nerves).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up electrodiagnostic studies performed 1 year after treatment revealed a slight increase in the amplitude of the left radial and left sural responses.

other_tests.findings: Normal, with no evidence of a demyelinating condition or abnormal enhancement.
Patchy signal abnormality mainly involving the posterior columns, asymmetric from left to right, extending from approximately the C3 level down to the C6 and C7 levels.
Needle-biopsy specimen showed small-cell lung cancer.
